title: Implicit Differentiation
text: Differentiate both sides of the equation.

title: Derivative Rules
text: Use the product rule and the chain rule. The product rule is: $$\frac{d\left(uv\right)}{dx}=u\left(\frac{dv}{dx}\right)+v\left(\frac{du}{dx}\right)$$. The chain rule is: $$[f(g(x))]'=\operatorname{f'}\left(g{\left(x\right)}\right) \operatorname{g'}\left(x\right)$$.

title: Finding $$\frac{dy}{dx}$$
text: What is $$\frac{d\left(y sin\left(xy\right)\right)}{dx}$$? Is $$sin\left(x y\right) \frac{dy}{dx}+y cos\left(x y\right) \left(\frac{x dy}{dx}+y\right)$$ the correct answer?

title: Simplifying $$\frac{dy}{dx}$$
text: Simplify such that $$\frac{dy}{dx}$$ is on one side of the equation.
